answers.answer: Hi...it would be helpful to know what your medical condition is, and what medications you are taking and why...

Hi Phil,Welcome to the Pain Management Community of MedHelp. We really do need more information to respond to your question. Sometimes medications can contribute to generalized aching and pain....or the wrong combination can cause it also.We'll look forward to hearing from you again.Take Care,Tuck

One of the medications is Metformin being taken to control blood sugar levelsbecause of Type II Diabetes.  Also take Wayfarin because of heart arrythmias andCardivedilol.  Metformin may have side effects of muscle aches but this is morerecent problem and pain travels in upper extremities (arms).  Also notice painbehind knees which is probably arthritis.

question: Taking several medications and trying determine if they may be contributing to travellingpain and muscle ache?
title: pharmacological contribution to symptoms
